newsitem.title: CANADA: Bank of Canada buys Canadian dollars - traders.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Canada buys Canadian dollars - traders.

text.p: The Bank of Canada intervened and bought Canadian dollars for U.S. dollars as the currency traded around the C$1.3940 level, dealers said.
The intervention was considered light as the currency weakened through key support.
Following the intervention, the Canadian dollar was trading at C$1.3931 after opening at C$1.3885 and Monday's close of C$1.3882. Traders expect further losses.
The Bank of Canada does not comment on intervention.
